  • Constructor Details

    • CircularQueue

      public CircularQueue(int capacity)
      Constructs a CircularQueue with the given capacity.
      Parameters:
      capacity - the maximum number of elements the queue can hold

  • Method Details

    • enqueue

      public void enqueue(T data)
      Adds an element to the queue. Wraps around if necessary.
      Parameters:
      data - the element to add
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the queue is full

    • dequeue

      public T dequeue()
      Removes and returns the front element of the queue.
      Returns:
      the front element
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the queue is empty

    • peek

      public T peek()
      Returns the front element without removing it.
      Returns:
      the front element
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the queue is empty

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the queue is empty.
      Returns:
      true if the queue has no elements, false otherwise

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Checks if the queue is full.
      Returns:
      true if the queue is at full capacity, false otherwise

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the current number of elements in the queue.
      Returns:
      the size of the queue

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears the queue, resetting it to an empty state.

    • printQueue

      public void printQueue()
      Prints the elements of the queue in order. Used for debugging purposes.

    • contains

      public boolean contains(T data)
      Searches the queue to see if it contains the data
      Parameters:
      data - the element to search for
      Returns:
      true if the data is found, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the queue is empty
